name: JW Marriott Washington DC

reviews.text: This JW Marriott is amazing - impressive lobby and very friendly staff. The Starbucks on site was very very welcome. I didn't have to pay for my stay as it was a business trip, but if I had the money I'd definitely stay there again. The location cannot be beat. Walk a few steps out of the hotel, look down the street and there's the capital building. The White House is just a short walk away (and I mean short - 5 minutes). The other restaurant inside the hotel (whose name I can't remember right now) had an excellent lunch buffet.
reviews.title: Elegance and awesome food

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent but that's about it. I stayed on the first floor with windows facing I don't know what. The room was pretty small and the service was not so good. The place looks good but does not function well. It definitely is not worth the money as you can find other hotels around D.C. I am a Marriott elite member and I was disappointed.
reviews.title: good location but that's it.

reviews.text: Let me say that I was able to get this room through a friends and family discount and this is not somewhere I would normally be able to stay. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and the Starbucks within the hotel was a nice perk. We had an incident w/ the pipes in our room and it was fixed in no time. Location was amazing and couldn't get any better. All that being said, it's an expensive hotel and not worth the cost (we're talking $300 a night). It does seem popular among business people and isn't really family orientated, but that doesn't mean that they're not family friendly. I’ve stayed at a lot of Marriotts because of our friends and family discount and to be honest, the only difference was the stylishness of the room. I have never had a problem w/ the quality of Marriott’s beds or rooms. Overall, staff was friendly and rooms were comfy. Location was excellent, but I would have liked a little more bang for my buck (like free wireless).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location...Very Expensive

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel with an exceptional location that makes touring DC very easy. Rooms are very nice, beds are comfy, baths are nice, but the rooms overall are very small. Their underground parking fills quickly but they will direct you to other parking garages. We stayed over Easter weekend and they did a great job of accomodating all the families, including setting up a great breakfast buffet in one of the ballrooms with a disney movie playing to keep the kids entertained. Plus they had an INDOOR pool which went over very well with the kiddies. Dinner in the restaurant was so so and service was slow. We loved DC and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal hotel in a great area. Read some negative reviews and don't understand them. The room was fine, service gracious, location ideal. Only the restaurant left something to be desired.
reviews.title: A find

reviews.text: I stayed two nights during a recent work trip. It's the best possible location. I was able to walk basically everywhere, and it was two block walk to the metro the one time I couldn't. As you'd expect from a big-city, up-market, modern hotel, the place is big, clean, comfortable, efficient, but nothing special and totally lacking any charm. My room was reasonably small but had everything you'd expect (bar, large tv, bathrobes, fluffy pillows, plenty of plugs, wi-fi.) The health club is full of machines. The pool is just big enough to do laps but VERY chlorinated. Full breakfast buffet, but again, nothing special. Lots of meeting rooms in the lobby. All in all, a very convenient place, it just won't leave many memories.
reviews.title: good, solid, well located, nothing more

likes.disliked: — lack of personality (but that's a minor complaint on a business trip)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early and asked for a room with a great view. Nothing available at the time we arrived (9am) but they checked our bags and off we went to sight see. Excellent Location to walk to everything. As mentioned the elevators are interesting but Great! We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We did have drinks and appetizers in the bar and very good. Hotel pricing, so not inexpensive. The rooms are not large but comfortable, and the bathroom is a bit smaller than you would think, but not a problem. I would hightly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.text: A super hotel in a really central location, 2 blocks down from the White House and in easy walking distance are the Washington Monument & the National Mall (10 mins) and The Capitol (20 mins). So this hotel is in a perfect location to see all the sights and is only 2 blocks away from the metro too.
reviews.title: Perfect base for seeing all the major sights

reviews.text: We paid extra for a room overlooking Pennsylvania Avenue (and requested a high floor) which was worth it, as we had a view of the Washington Monument.
reviews.title: No extra effort

reviews.text: The room was spacious even with 2 double beds but the bathroom was on the small side. Huge TV, comfy beds, good quality linen and loads of towels.
reviews.title: Visit of D.C with the grandchildren

reviews.text: Although this hotel wasn't the best one I have ever stayed at, the location was absolutely wonderful! Within walking distance was the National Monument, and trolley stands for the tours in DC. The rooms were clean and comfortable (in terms of beds, pillows, and mattresses). The bathroom was a little bit small, but still clean and maid service was consistent.
reviews.title: Great Location
Excellent location. Lovely facilities. Very courteous employees.
reviews.text: The lobby and restaurant where we had breakfast was also very nice and clean. The brekfast did seem outrageously priced, Over $60 for cereal and small omelette. There was a CVS about a block and a half away where we bought snacks for the room, so that saved us a couple of bucks!
The elevators (as some have already mentioned) are a little weird, but really not at all difficult once you figure out their system.
reviews.title: In the heart of DC

likes.liked: — hotel property, location, new sleek elevator system

reviews.text: The one complaint we had was that the pool was disgusting. The pool was indoors, but had an outdoor area adjacent to it. The tile around the pool was rusty and slimy looking and the pool itself looked like it needed a little refurbishing. It seemed as though it wasn't part of the rest of the hotel, which was kept very nice.
reviews.title: Great Trip to DC

reviews.text: All in all, the hotel was convenient and clean. Great for a quick getaway. I would recommend that if the pool is a consideration for your stay here, don't bother.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Went for a 5 day trip to D.C. with my sister in Mid-August. The hotel was in a great location and did not disappoint. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was small but what do you expect in a larger city! Room was clean and elevator system was highly efficient. Check-in was easy and the location allows you to be in the middle of many sights! Great breakfast buffet and service in the main restaurant.
reviews.title: Great location and hotel with minor problems

reviews.text: Be sure to ask for a room on one of the top floors with a mall view.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Problems:
reviews.title: Great inter-city Hotel

likes.disliked: — I hate valet parking - it's a personal thing

reviews.title: Makes Our "Top Five DC Hotels" List
reviews.text: Our room was not made up one day. We called housekeeping when we returned to our room and were asked if we had left our 'Do Not Disturb' sign out...no...so someone was there within 10 minutes. Was not upset with the question that was asked just the WAY it was asked!

Service in the bar restaurant was horrible! A large group of men there for an IT conference monopolized the time of the waitress. I actually had to get up and place our order at the bar as well as check on it and order drinks from the bar too. Need more wait staff!
reviews.title: great location
Avoid Room 1102
reviews.text: Management certainly knows Room 1102 abuts an air shaft that is so loud it sounds like you're under a flight path or the F train is passing by...continually. Otherwise the hotel is fine.

I stayed here from January 10-13 and found the hotel to be top notch. The lobby was inviting and check in was easy. The staff was polite and helpful. My room was clean and well appointed but unlike concierge level rooms at most other Marriott properties there was no complimentary water in the room. The concierge lounge was well appointed and offered some of the best food of any Marriott property. It's 14th floor view was great and looked out over the Washington Monument. While the lounge often put out 100 bottles or more of water it seemed to go very quickly. This was one of the most crowded lounges I have been to.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service

reviews.text: The health club was small but clean and not crowded most times. The equipment was well taken care of. The valet service was timely for the most part but parking is limited. If the valet has no room you will be directed to one of three other garages within a couple of blocks of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great, reliable stay

reviews.text: This hotel is across the street from the Ronald Reagan Building and is within walking distance to the Washington Monument, The White House, and several area museums. All in all this JW Marriott is top notch, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always, this hotel serves up a positive experience. Very comfortable, very helpful staff, beautiful surroundings. Recommended for business travel.
reviews.title: Not Intimate or Original!

reviews.text: I can almost agree entirely with the other reviewer. We booked our room through the hotel website. There were 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 children and on arrival we were allocated a room with 1 bed!! Not very helpful staff, disinterested and abrupt. We were not offered any assistance with our luggage upon arrival. You'd think that a family arriving with 3 small kids and 5 suitacases may need some help, but the staff couldn't be bothered.
reviews.title: Disappointing Experience

likes.disliked: — Apalling lack of service and assistance from staff.

reviews.text: When we were shifted to another room, it was not on the same floor as we'd paid to be on. It had zero room. Bathroom way too small, beds very squishy and uncomfortable. They squeezed a roll away bed in as well and none of us could move.
reviews.title: A disappointing experience

reviews.text: We received no information from reception about breakfast lounge location, facillities etc. Needless to say, we went to the wrong place in the hotel for breakfast (we were meant to go to the concierge lounge - like we'd paid for) and were charged extra.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Overall very disappointing. We would not stay here again and I would not recomend this hotel. The location is very good though. Personally, I'd stay somewhere else and enjoy the opportunity to walk a bit further to see the sights. This place was not what I expected at all.
reviews.title: Great Location if you get a good price...

likes.disliked: — small bathroom, but they had nice amenities to make up for that.

reviews.title: Nice, but I utterly detest the "touch sensitive" tray of goodies
reviews.text: This property is in a fabulous location for seeing all the sights. Withing easy walking distance of the White House and all the museums. The lobby of the hotel is very pretty, but the staff is less than helpful and friendly. They messed up our reservation and put us in the wrong room. When we called down to try and correct the situation, the lady got hateful and hung up on us. It was eventually made ok. Our preordered room service was all incorrect and there is construction going on at the the hotel - of which we were unaware. We were awakened our first 3 mornings at 6am by hammering. I complained and they took off $100 from our bill. The room is very small and the bathroom accomodates only 1 person at a time. The bed is very, very soft, so if you require a firm mattress, be prepared to sleep poorly. Overall, if I had to do it again, I would probably bite the extra money and stay at the Willard which is just across the street. We are even Marriott frequent stay members.

We stayed at the JW Marriott for the second time in July, while we dropped our daughter off at camp at GWU (we spent a night at the Madison Loews on the back end, but only because they were more accomodating to our dog). The location can only be beaten by a handful of DC hotels (if at all); monuments, White House, etc. within walking distance, for the most part. So for touring purposes, it should be considered. As for the hotel itself; it's mostly satisfactory. The renovation that was ongoing when we last visited appears to have been completed, with the elevators most notable changed -- they now operate on a high-tech, sometimes frustrating, sometimes efficient system that eliminated buttons in-car. Interesting. The pool is a Marriott pool, nothing more, nothing less. The rooms are also just fine -- smallish compared to the last JW Marriott at which we stayed, but par for the course for a JW Marriott in the middle of a large metropolis, I suppose. They're very well-maintained. The hotel is for sure oriented toward conventions and business travelers; that much is clear just by looking at the lobby crowd any given morning. There are multiple floors of meeting spaces, etc. with merely a functional lobby. This lack of a real public space could be a bit offputting to a pleasure traveler, but it is what it is. The service is correspondingly standoffish and stiff -- as efficient as any veteran traveler would want, but by no means warm. The exception is the valet staff, which is simply incompetant. If you're in a rush, call for your car well in advance. Overall -- recommended, but it's not making the hotel hall of fame anytime soon. its address is its most compelling feature, and that shouldn't be overlooked.
reviews.title: Great City Views and Location!

reviews.text: We just returned from 2 nights at the Marriott on Pennsylvania Ave. and loved it. We found the hotel beautiful, a great location, and the staff was very friendly. We were lucky to get a full view of the Washington Monument from our room. The rooms were about the size you would expect from a downtown big city hotel; not very big but fine. The elevator is not too "techy." It was simple to figure out and very convenient. The pool was nice, but it's the location that would get us back. Great stay.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel is my personal favorite. The JW Marriott is literally one block away from the white house and in walking distance to the metro. There is a trolley station one block away from the hotel but it may be at the hotel if a special person is there. I stayed there during thanksgiving (in my opinion the best time to go because everything is open but there is no crowds). I was there before the renovation and it was a wonderful hotel. One bad thing I do have to say, which is minimal is that the thanksgiving dinner was expensive. I went in there yesterday since I was in Washington and they have remodeled it. The rooms are great, and government rate is really cheap. The staff is also some of the most friendly at any hotel I have ever stayed at. This hotel is my favorite.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in DC!

likes.liked: — good food, nice rooms, great lobby, great lounge

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the JW Marriott in Washington, Dc and loved it. The location was perfect and the rooms are a little tiny but they have been nicely updated. The high tech elevators were a little annoying and the concierge/front desk service left a little to be desired. Our room was quiet and the breakfast buffet (we had a package deal, so it was included) is fantastic. The location is 2 blocks from the Metro Center Metro station, 2 blocks from the White House, 8 blocks from Chinatown and 12 blocks from GW's campus.
reviews.title: Great location and hotel

reviews.text: Visited 7/18-21. Can't say enough about the location as it's within walking distance of the National Mall and White House. The rooms are standard fare and clean. This is an extremely busy hotel, but we weren't bothered by all of the traffic. Parking was slow when we checked in, but it was weekend traffic and a convention in town. Valet parking $35 nightly (steep). Call ahead for your car, usually a 10-15 wait. Many good restaurants in the vicinity (5-10 minutes by car).
reviews.title: Great Location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a nice place, but the D.C. Marriott Residence Inns are just as good, so the value of JW Marriott is not there.
reviews.title: Nothing special.

reviews.text: Rooms were not large. We used (a lot of) points to try out this JW Marriott. It was not worth it. My friend's Marriott Platinum status and a fair amount of questioning were required to secure a room with a view.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet, parking, etc. were not free, of course. I believe there was an indoor pool.
reviews.title: Wow. Wow..... Wow

reviews.text: Late November I took a business trip to DC. Several meetings were booked at the hotel as well as hotel rooms for all the participants. The hotel is located in a great place, very near the white house, mall, monuments, etc. I checked in early morning and was offered a room with two beds, which I took rather than wait for a king. I was surprised to have a great view of the fountains and Washington monument, even from the third floor. The room was a little worn around the edges. I expected a little more from a JW, but it easily qualified as a decent business hotel (I am a tough grader). Staff was polite, but not personable. Nice lobby for meeting people. I slept well, the room was pretty quiet, even with a low floor. Had issues with noisy staff behind the meeting rooms. I would recommend the hotel if a good rate can be achieved.
reviews.title: Great Location, comfy beds, pricey...

reviews.text: OK, first of all, our room was not typical. No idea what a normal room at this hotel would be like, but we on a Marriott Rewards stay, we were upgraded to the Vice Presidential Suite, and everything was exceptional. I could go on and on about the room, but let's face it, we'll never get the chance to stay in the VP Suite again, and it's not a typical room ( what with the 3 TVs, dining room, living room, and 6 head shower. If this is the VP suote, ou have to wonder what the Presidential Suite looks like.). But there are a few things that should be relevant to all:
reviews.title: Very honest Maid!

reviews.text: Our family of 4, children ages 10 and 8, stayed here for a week after Christmas thru the New Year. I really don't think there could be a better location for someone here to sightsee in the city. We walked to EVERYTHING (except of course the day we drove to Mt. Vernon). I ditto pretty much everything people have already written- loved the lobby, loved the Starbucks, loved our high floor room with a view of the Washington Monument and Lincoln Memorial, room was great, staff was INCREDIBLE- every person we encountered, indoor pool was nice, positives, positives, positives.
reviews.title: A great trip, PRIMO location!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but did get drinks and munchies in the bar/eatery, even with the kids- very relaxed atmosphere- us hanging here in comfy arm chairs with our computers and kids with their electronic devices on New Year's Day (we were zonked after a day of walking everywhere!)
reviews.title: Fantastic location for walking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate in many of the surrounding restaurants, nary a bad meal. We ate breakfast almost daily in the little corner restaurant down the street out the front door and to the right- can't find the name of it in any of the other reviews! By the end of the week, they knew us there which was fun for the kids.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Terrible Valet Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not use the valet, as we were there for a week and trying to save $$, so we parked in a garage down the street a block- saved us over $100.
reviews.title: Great location & views

reviews.text: Kids were given adorable Washington DC snow globes when we checked in, which made them so happy!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic location for a DC visit, but I'm glad I paid a group rate.

reviews.text: The plusses: Location – as other reviewers have stated, the hotel’s location can’t be beat. The view from our room (#823) was very nice, overlooking the Ellipse and the Washington Monument. If you stay here, you have to get an exterior room with a view, otherwise you will NOT be happy with what you see out your window (almost prison-like view, I would say). There are some good restaurants nearby (Old Ebbits is one of our favorites and we tried and liked the nearby Elephant and Castle for a nightcap and lunch the next day).The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. We asked for an extra luggage rack and had it within minutes. The exercise room was large and well appointed. The room had a large flat screen HD TV. Other plusses: a nightly turn-down service (with chocolate mints), bath robes and the Washington Post delivered to your door. There is a Starbucks right off the lobby that opens early.
reviews.title: Smallish rooms

reviews.text: The minuses: The soundproofing around the room’s door was terrible – you could actually see the gaps around the door frame. We could hear every hallway conversation rather clearly (must people talk so loudly in the hallway at midnight?). There is a $10 charge for using the internet - it should be free. The room was on the small side (but the view made up for it). My wife thought the bed was a little uncomfortable and the mattress pad did not fit the mattress and kept slipping off. The valet parking was pricey at $35 and there is no guarantee that you will get parking (a sign later that evening stated “Parking Full – See attendant for other options”). Tip: the hotel’s entrance is on 14th Street, not Pennsylvania Avenue.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay and the location is excellent

likes.disliked: — Exercise facility and the inability to get a king bed or much of a late check-out

reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the JW Marriott for 4 nights just this past week. What a GREAT property!
reviews.title: Simply WONDERFUL!

likes.liked: — Great rooms, wonderful location, helpful & professional staff

reviews.text: Let's start with the location. Who wouldn't like a view of the Washington Monument from their hotel room window? Or wouldn't want to be just a couple of blocks away from the museums, monuments, sites, etc? There is a nice food court right next door. The Ronald Reagen building is just a block over and has a food court as well. And if you're not worried about $$, there's many nice restaurants in walking distance. Truthfully we only took the Metro to get to the hotel (and back) from the airport and when we went to Union Station. Otherwise, it's not needed!
reviews.title: great location, hotel just as expected from a Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is nicely appointed and very clean. A negative is that the mini-bar has some high tech sensors, so do NOT remove an item to just look at it. (important to note when traveling with children). If you do so, you will be immediately charged for the item. (front desk was wonderful in helping us remove the charges) The bathroom is on the smaller side, but again, nicely appointed.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL IN WASHINGTON D.C. (friendly staff, great location)

likes.liked: — Close proximity to most attractions in Washington DC ~~~ friendly staff

reviews.text: Additionally, we did eat at the casual restaurant and the lounge on-site. Both were very nice and priced accordingly. As with the other employees, the service was excellent!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Overall, we couldn't be more thrilled with this property. We said many times during our stay, that it would be awfully tough to justify staying somewhere else.
reviews.title: Close to all the sites

aka: Jw Marriott Washington Dc Hotel Washington Dc
description: At JW Marriott Washington, DC, we've thought of all the details so you don't have to. Our staff is well-versed in anticipating the needs of our guests and providing an environment of peaceful luxury. We offer state-of-the-art technology that you've come to expect while traveling in each of our guest rooms including 37" LCD HDTVs, connectivity panels for laptops, MP3 players and cameras, and high-speed internet access throughout. Situated near some of the most recognizable landmarks in Washington DC, our hotel provides easy access to renowned monuments, the National Mall, museums, and other cultural venues around the city like the National Theatre, the Convention Center and the National Portrait Gallery. Additionally, we are conveniently located around the corner from the White House, one block from the Metro and 15 minutes from Reagan National Airport.Our unbeatable location and attentive service allow you to enjoy the very best of the nation's capital.
